field.name: LIQUID ARC
field.definition: Note that if the type is not STANDARD, then the 'collide_with_stuff' and material effects will not have any effect. In addition, the 'natural_length' will not have an effect except as a means to compute the collision fraction.

field.name: HORIZONTAL RANGE
field.definition: In world units, how far the noise extends horizontally. By default the horizontal range is along the world XY plane.

field.name: VERTICAL RANGE
field.definition: In world units, how far the noise extends vertically. By default the vertical range is along the world Z axis (up).

field.name: ROUGHNESS
field.definition: Roughness controls how the different 'octaves' of noise get scaled. Usually it is in the range [0,1] but it can be slightly higher or lower and still make sense (zero is actually a pretty decent value). The mathematical equation used is 2^(-k*(1-r)) where 'k' is the octave index starting at 0 and 'r' is the roughness value.

field.name: NOISE FREQUENCIES
field.definition: 4 sprites is 3 octaves 8 sprites is 4 octaves 16 sprites is 5 octaves 32 sprites is 6 octaves 64 sprites is 7 octaves 128 sprites is 8 octaves 256 sprites is 9 octaves, etc.

field.name: BRIGHTNESS/FACING
field.definition: Brightness when facing perpendicular versus parallel.

field.name: RANGE-COLLISION SCALE
field.definition: Scales range (amplitude) by collision fraction. The input to the function will be 1 if there is no collision, and 0 if the collision occurs at the origin.
